properties.Mission: Art Gallery, Performance and Event Venue, Wine Bar
The Center for the Arts is a cultural and educational organization that promotes and presents the literary, visual, and performing arts for the enrichment of our community.

Our auditorium at the CAC is well-equipped for your next public or private event. Features include a large stage, theatrical lighting, and live audio production equipment. You can also project films or other media content to a full-size cinema screen, the only one in Truckee!

Sierra Theaters is a locally owned, family business that operates Sierra Cinemas, The Del Oro Theatre, Sutton Cinemas, and The Nevada Theatre Film Series. Each theatre features comfortable seats, friendly staff, and state-of-the-art projection and sound. The popcorn is delicious, too!

Elixart is an herbal elixir lounge and visionary art gallery offering the highest integrity and highest vibration ingredients throughout our menu of mood-enhancing elixir drinks, kava, tea, and other exotics; raw food, and premium organic products.

The Foothills Event Center offers elegant gathering spaces, along with a wide array of specialized services and onsite rentals to create a memorable event for your guests. Our experienced staff is eager to work closely with you to ensure your vision is brought to life for the perfect celebration, right down to the fine details.

This treasured historic venue is the meeting and special events facility for veterans groups including the American Legion Post No.130, Disabled American Veterans, Marine Corps League, and the Vietnam Veterans. As a service to the community this facility is available to rent year around. This multipurpose venue was renovated in 2008 to provide modern comfort while preserving its historic character.
The McIver Rodeo Arena hosts the annual Truckee Rodeo featuring the Truckee Donner Horsemen. It is also available to rent for a variety of horse-friendly uses.

The Miners Foundry Cultural Center is a living historic treasure serving Nevada County as a cultural arts and community events center.  More than a venue, the nonprofit's mission is to preserve, enhance and utilize the historic Miners Foundry for cultural, educational and social activities in Nevada County.

Located in Grass Valley, California, the Nevada County Fairgrounds has been declared as  California's Most Beautiful Fairgrounds, and is covered with hundreds of towering pine trees on almost 90 acres. It is home to the annual Nevada County Fair, the Draft Horse Classic, the Country Christmas Faire, world-class music festivals, and year-round community events. There is also a year-round RV Park, Lions Lake, rental facilities, weekly events, weddings, some of our community's largest outdoor events, and lots of areas to walk.

The Nevada Theatre is the oldest existing theatre building on the west coast that continues to operate as a theatre. We are now celebrating 152 years of history, live performances, music, movies and art in Nevada County.

The North Columbia Schoolhouse Cultural Center gives the rural San Juan Ridge community a local place to meet, to share its creativity, and to participate in a wide variety of enriching activities. Located 20 miles north of Nevada City, the Schoolhouse was built by the mining community in 1875, and has a long tradition of serving the community as a school and public meeting hall.

The North Star House is a 10,000 square foot mansion, built in the California Craftsman style in 1905.  The North Star House is listed on the National and State Registers of Historic Places. It is located on a portion of the former North Star Mine, a 14-acre site of spectacular Gold Country landscapes. The North Star House is owned, operated and being lovingly restored by the North Star Historic Conservancy, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

We produce only comedies, and most of these are musicals, with a slant toward familiar hit songs of the 1950's and 60's. Intimate cabaret seating and a relaxed and friendly atmosphere add to the uniqueness of the experience.  Also, we provide a modestly priced selection of refreshments, including locally produced wines, desserts, coffee and other beverages, served at your table before the show and during intermission.
Our professionally equipped studio theater located at the back of our building at 315 Richardson Street offers an intimate space suitable for a wide variety of performances and events.

The Bandshell is designed for acoustic music and is therefore a nice location for an event offered by a concert band or small music event. Amplified music is discouraged at this location. The Bandshell is also a nice location for a family & friends gathering. Power, water and private bathrooms are available at this location.

The Onyx Theatre is dedicated to bringing the very best in independent, foreign language, and documentary film to our region. We make a conscious commitment to screen works from underrepresented communities and alternative perspectives; fostering understanding and the creative spirit.

Set near the Truckee River, just across the Legacy Trail, lies The Salty Gebhart Amphitheater. An outdoor entertainment venue with comfortable lawn seating overlooks a generous stage for all sorts of performances. It's also the home of our annual Wednesday Summer Music Series! Popular uses include weddings, concerts, and plays.
Shady Creek Outdoor School and Conference Center is a 132-acre property located in the Sierra Nevada Foothills just outside of Nevada City in California's Gold Country.

Sierra Theaters is a locally owned, family business that operates Sierra Cinemas, The Del Oro Theatre, Sutton Cinemas, and The Nevada Theatre Film Series. Each theatre features comfortable seats, friendly staff, and state-of-the-art projection and sound. The popcorn is delicious, too!

Sierra Theaters is a locally owned, family business that operates Sierra Cinemas, The Del Oro Theatre, Sutton Cinemas, and The Nevada Theatre Film Series. Each theatre features comfortable seats, friendly staff, and state-of-the-art projection and sound.Ã¦ The popcorn is delicious, too!

The mission of Truckee Community Theater is to create opportunities for community participation in theatrical offerings of the highest possible quality presented to audiences at affordable prices. We are dedicated to providing theatrical training to residents of all ages through plays, workshops, camps, and classes, to offer arts education that promotes life long learning, to collaborate with other local arts organizations, and to celebrate the power of theater to illuminate our common humanity.

Word After Word Books is a welcoming space for the community and visitors to connect around books. We carry titles by local authors, regional and history books about the area, and books and magazines pertaining to the outdoor lifestyle in our community. We also have the latest bestsellers and favorite staff picks. There is a section for children and young adults, the Kids & Teens Corner, with comfy beanbag chairs. The Word After Word Team hosts author events, writing workshops, book clubs, and story times.
